p.shortTitle: An Bille Staidrimh (Céad Bliain Éirí Amach 1916), 2016
AN BILLE STAIDRIMH (CÉAD BLIAIN ÉIRÍ AMACH 1916), 2016

tocItem.inline: Amendment of section 33 of Statistics Act 1993 - Exception
Amendment of section 35 of Statistics Act 1993 - 1916 Centenary commemoration release
Amendment of section 35 of Statistics Act 1993
Amendment of section 38 of Statistics Act 1993 - Non-offence

p.shortTitle: AN BILLE STAIDRIMH (CÉAD BLIAIN ÉIRÍ AMACH 1916), 2016

longTitle.p: An Act to amend the Statistics Act 1993, in relation to the first Census of Population of Ireland taken since the establishment of the State; to afford that census a special heritage status and to have such released to the public for historical, genealogical and other research as part of the national centenary of the 1916 Rising, and the Decade of Centenaries, commemorations.

formula.name: enacted
formula.p: Be it enacted by the Oireachtas as follows:

content.p: “1911 Census” means the last Census of Population taken by the British authorities for the entire island of Ireland;
“1926 Census” means the first Census of Population taken by Saorstát Éireann;

section.heading: Amendment of section 33 of Statistics Act 1993 - Exception

content.p: Section 33(1) of the Principal Act is amended by the insertion of “save in the case of section 35(2),” after “or undertaking shall,”.

section.heading: Amendment of section 35 of Statistics Act 1993 - 1916 Centenary commemoration release

content.p: Section 35 of the Principal Act is amended by substituting the following subsection for the existing section⁠—

In the case of a Census of Population undertaken under this Act or under the repealed enactments, the restrictions of sections 32 and 33 of this Act shall cease to apply 100 years after the date of the relevant Census, or earlier in the case of subsection (2).”.

section.heading: Amendment of section 35 of Statistics Act 1993

content.p: Section 35 of the Principal Act is amended by the insertion of the following subsection after subsection (1)⁠—

In the case of the 1926 Census of Population due to its importance as the first Census taken since 1911 and the first taken since the establishment of the State and in recognition, therefore, of its special historical and genealogical significance section 35(1) shall not apply and that An Taoiseach shall make the relevant arrangements to have the information contained within, and any records associated with, that Census released as part of the national centenary of the 1916 Rising, and the Decade of Centenaries, commemorations.”.

section.heading: Amendment of section 38 of Statistics Act 1993 - Non-offence

content.p: Section 38 of the Principal Act is amended by the insertion of the following after the words “guilty of an offence”:
“, unless it is in relation to Census records relating to the 1926 Census as per section 35(2).”.

intro.p: This Act may be cited as the Statistics (1916 Rising Centenary) Act 2016.
